captions.text: It's my personal favorite.
[turns radio on]
[adjusts frequency]

[man on radio]
joe egan and gerry rafferty
were a duo
Known as stealer's wheel
When they recorded

This dylanesque,
pop, bubble-gum favorite
From April of 1974.

That reached up
to number five,

As k-billy's super sounds
of the seventies <i>continues.</i>

ś well, I don't know
why I came here tonight ś

ś I got the feeling that
somethin' ain't right ś

ś I'm so scared in case
I fall off my chair ś

ś and I'm wonderin' how
I'll get down the stairs ś

ś clowns to
the left of me ś
ś jokers to the right ś
ś here I am ś

ś stuck in the middle
with you ś

ś yes, I'm stuck
in the middle with you ś

ś and I'm wonderin' what
it is I should do ś
Hold still.

ś and joy breaks out
all over the place ś
<i>Hold still, you fuck!</i>

ś clowns to
the left of me ś
ś jokers to the right ś
ś here I am ś

ś stuck in the middle
with you ś

ś well, you started out
with nothin' ś

ś and you're proud that
you're a self-made man ś

ś and your family
all come crawlin' ś

ś slap you on the back
and say... ś

That as good for you
as it was for me?
Hey, what's going on?
You hear that?
[cries continue]

Don't go anywhere.
I'll be right back.

ś but I can see it
makes no sense at all ś

title: Stuck in the Middle With You - Reservoir Dogs (5/12) Movie CLIP (1992) HD

comments.text:
I know there's got to be some people here that watch Chicago P.D., am I 
alone in that I could just see Hank Voight do this dance around a perp? I 
know it's not his style, he's too serious and straight to the point with 
criminals but still, I could just picture him do that, just maybe not 
actually cut the poor bastard's ear off, not all the way at least.﻿

comments.author: Traye76

comments.text:
+Michael.YouTube I don't want this to come off as mean or anything. This is 
a film that deserves to be analyzed and have people's opinions form on 
that. In my case, I said that's he's a maniac with a reason because he 
tortured the cop brutally, just to get some for of information on who the 
rat is. When it comes to Blonde, I don't think he knew Mr. Orange was the 
right just yet. Not to mention that Mr. Orange was mostly unconscious 
throughout the torture; he only woke up when Blonde ripped the duct tape 
off the officer's mouth and he started to scream. When Blonde went to get 
the gasoline, the officer must have had some form of communication with Mr. 
Orange so that the cop knew how Mr. Orange was going to take out Blonde.
comments.author: James Caraven

comments.text:
+Frost Cast...you need to re-watch the film, because you're incorrect. The 
other members wanted information on who the unloyal one in the group was; 
but Mr. Blonde says that he specifically just desires to watch torture and 
death to the fellow officer.

comments.author: Willie Wilson

comments.text:
"I just love it when the anguish comes and the pleading. It is so great
to witness suffering and terror. I don't understand why ALL movies
aren't like that." This movie was mild compared to the "Hostler" movies.
Don't you guys just love movies when you get the WHOLE THING!!
I mean... why not!! What the whole TRUTH is there has to be a stop,
otherwise "snuff movies" would be acceptable. What is wrong with you
people who enjoy all this terrible suffering? The above quote was from
something "Jeffrey Dalmer" said to someone. If you don't know who Jeffrey 
Dalmer
was, then THANK YOU, and you should not see Reservoir Dogs or any horrible 
movie like this.﻿
comments.author: Wesley Hay

comments.text:
Dahmer repented for his sins. He wasn't truly evil like so many believe. He 
just had uncontrollable compulsions... I know how hard it can be to deal 
with that. And he felt remorse for what he did which technically 
disqualifies him from being a psychopath. He let himself be killed for what 
he did. I truly believe Dahmer is at peace now, in heaven with our Lord.
